data.name: List of numbers in English
data.description:
Several existing [kata](https://www.codewars.com/kata/53c94a82689f84c2dd00007d) tackle the problem of converting an integer into a string of words.

Here, we imagine writing out the words for all integers from ```1``` to ```1000000000``` in one giant string.

No spaces, no hyphens, no commas, no use of the conjunction "and".

Like this:
```
"onetwothree...ninehundredninetyninemillionninehundredninetyninethousandninehundredninetynineonebillion"
```

Your task is to find a given number in this string:

```haskell
indexOf :: Integer -> Integer

indexOf 1 = 0
indexOf 2 = 3

-- and so on
```

All values tested will be in the valid range ```1 .. 1000000000```
